eric.name: Eric's WFS Playbook
eric.description: Complete word-for-script framework from opening through close
eric.philosophy: Follow a simple structure. Understand goals, identify where they want to go, and if we can help, show how we come into the picture.

scripts: How are you? Good morning to you
Doing well, doing really well. Staying outta trouble mainly. So good on my end.
Doing well. Staying outta trouble mainly. So good on, good on my end.

How was the, the week or the weekend rather?
How are you? How was the, the weekend?
How has your week been so far?
How's the week? How was the, uh, the weekend for you?

rapport_extensions.for_vacation: Oh, geez. Nice little, uh, vacation. / Sweet back. Uh, batteries are recharged.

Yeah. All good. Well, well, we'll keep it simple then.
Got it man. Well, well, we'll keep it short and sweet.

time_frame_setting.script: We usually make these calls 30, 45 minutes. It just depends on how many questions you guys have.

authority_statement.script: I've done a few thousand of these, so definitely, uh, been been through a few different, uh, fun, fun convos

versions: but the, the most productive ones follow, uh, simple structure. Really just want to understand like what goals you guys have, where you're looking to go in vending. And if we can help, then I'll walk you guys through how we can come into the picture and, and assist.

the, the, the simplest ones that we'll go through a couple questions, we'll understand where you're at now, where you want to go, and if we can help, then I'll walk you through how they can come into the picture and assist.

the, the ones that are, um, they're productive that just follow a simple structure. We'll just go through like what you're looking for in the vending space, where you're at now, where you want to go. And if we can help then, uh, we'll go through the, the, how we can comment out the picture and assist.

decision_framework.name: Binary Choice Setup
decision_framework.primary_script: For efficiency at the end of the call, I'm gonna recommend the option that aligns closest to what you guys are looking for. And by that point, most people are very aware if this solution can help them achieve their goals or not. So it's totally fine to say yes or no. The one I would love to avoid is 'we'd like to think about it' or 'talk to our dog' as we both know that's a really polite way to say no. So is it cool if we try to keep it between either a yes or a no today?
variations: For efficiency, at the end of the call, I'm gonna recommend the investment option that makes the most sense for what you're looking for. By that point, most people are, are very aware if what we can provide can even help them or not. It's, it's fine to say yes or no. The one thing I'd love to avoid is I needed to think about it or talk to my dog. 'cause we both know that's like a really polite way of just saying no. So is it cool if we try to keep it between a yes or a no today?

For efficiency, at the end of the call, Alan, I'm gonna recommend the investment option that makes the most sense. By, by that point, most people are, are very aware if, if the solution we can provide can even help them achieve their goals or not. Uh, it's, it's fine to say yes or no. The one thing I'd love to avoid is I need to think about it or talk to my dog. 'cause that's a very polite way of just saying no. So is it, is it cool if we try to keep it between a yes or a no today?

key_elements.efficiency_framing: For efficiency at the end of the call...
key_elements.awareness_building: most people are very aware if this solution can help them achieve their goals or not
key_elements.permission_seeking: So it's totally fine to say yes or no
key_elements.think_it_over_killer: The one I would love to avoid is 'we'd like to think about it' or 'talk to our dog' as we both know that's a really polite way to say no

when_they_resist.prospect_says: Um, I'll do my best. I'll do my best. All good? Yeah.
when_they_resist.response: Sounds good. Yeah, just, just, uh, I think you could appreciate it. Just like, um, getting away from the maybes, just if it's like, Hey, this is in line, or no, this is way off, then totally good. Like, either, either way.

clarification.prospect_says: Yeah. And I'm fully aware. I mean, even if I say yes, doesn't mean that, I mean, that just means yes, let's continue to, to talk. Doesn't, I'm not signing on anything today kind of thing, right?
clarification.response: That's what we're looking for. Yeah... That, that's mainly what we're looking for is just like a, a way to save us both time. Um, versus like a, um, a yes. That was never a yes from the beginning.

psychological_techniques.time_scarcity: For efficiency... (creates impression time is limited)
psychological_techniques.social_proof_pressure: most people are very aware... (implies smart people decide quickly)
psychological_techniques.either_or_thinking: totally fine to say yes or no (eliminates middle ground)

matt.name: Matt Chubb's Objection Playbook
matt.description: Complete objection handling approach with philosophy and specific techniques
core_principles: Cook their logic - find the flaw in their reasoning and create dialogue around a new perspective
Buy-in and double buy-in - always get them to explain WHY before moving forward
90% of the time it's a mask - most objections are hiding the real concern (usually fear or finance)
Pattern interrupt - when they're bullshitting you, call them out with humor or directness
Go back to the Holy Grail - always tie decisions back to their ultimate goal
TODAY is the key word - emphasis on moving forward TODAY creates commitment
Never silence after price drop - immediately connect price to value and their goals
Win the responsibility frame - critical for spouse/authority objections

capital_objection.philosophy: Finances are a precious conversation. Naturally, their guard is going to be a little bit up.
capital_objection.three_path_question: Is it a case, let's say we're doing Bronze, right? Is it the case you've got the full $6,000 that's, you know, just a little bit difficult or scary to invest? Or do you have some of it when you look at breaking it up into a more manageable structure? Or you've got none of it at all, and we need to go to the bank or something.
why_it_works: That last bit takes the air out of the room
Immediately categorizes into three clear paths
Reduces defensiveness by normalizing all scenarios
capital_objection.god_drop_test: If God dropped $6K in your lap right now, would you be ready to move forward? Or would you want to go away and maybe spend that on a holiday somewhere?
capital_objection.finding_their_number: I guess, you know, for you, really, based on your finances right now, how much do you have able and willing to invest in yourself so that you can take that first step to achieving [their Holy Grail]?
capital_objection.credit_card_mask: Look, brother, like finance is the easy bit, not to worry. So what's really more important to me is your commitment. Like if we can find something that does work for you again, like does that help you move forward?
capital_objection.debt_reframe: Of course, it's not a case of debt. Like I go heavy on my pitch about how the business pays for the business and its investment in itself.

sticker_shock.critical_rule: Never, first of, never ever do I do like silence after a price drop like a cliffhanger, like awful because it's just awkward and weird
sticker_shock.price_drop_script: Yeah so Adam look, you know, next steps is of course that investment of $6,000 USD. If you're ready to get started what we normally do is get you onboarded on the call, we send over a contract and we get you essentially access to everything so that you can take that first step and start building up this vending route, so you can start to actually not only bring in those 10k months but also leave the job, spend more time with the family. All comes down to you and how you're feeling man.

response_framework.step1_agree: Look man, like, agree, first of like, it is expensive, right, don't get me wrong, it's not a cup of coffee.
response_framework.step2_reframe: What you want is also a lot there, right, would that be fair to say? Like, it's not just the ability to sort of leave your job and to bring in some income, but it's more so about the ability to build something so that you can actually live life on your own terms.
response_framework.step3_future_pace: The version of you 12 months down the line who's got all of that, would you look back and think, like, that was not worth $6,000?

sticker_shock.program_reframe: Just to be on the same page, it's not just a program, right? This isn't like a plug and play thing you just come in and you just learn some things. This is coaching, mentorship, guidance, having the systems and the people in place so that you can transform X, Y, Z to X, Y, Z.
sticker_shock.key_point: PROGRAM is a horrific word - always reframe as coaching/mentorship

spouse_objection.philosophy: 90% of the time, spouse/partner is a mask. It's uncovering something else.
buy_in_framework: Step 1: Do you believe XYZ can work to get you to here?
Step 2: Get double buy-in - have them explain WHY
Step 3: Partner buy-in - is he/she on board with you setting up a system to provide more for the family?
Step 4: In the past, has anything ever come up or gotten in the way of you two when it comes to making a decision similar to this?

responsibility_frame.setup: Your partner, what does she do for work? When she's at the salon doing her thing, making decisions, putting everything in place to make sure her role is a success - she doesn't rely on you to make any of those decisions for her, right?
responsibility_frame.pivot: Why would it be fair for you to go away, have that conversation, and put some of the decision and responsibility for your future, for your life, and ultimately your family as the man of the household, and push any of that decision onto her?
responsibility_frame.clarify: I'm not saying she can't be there to lean on. But when it comes to the decision and responsibility to take the first step, whose responsibility does that fall on?
responsibility_frame.close: The version of you who's got X, Y, Z and this amazing family - what decision would he make here?

spouse_objection.ceo_frame: You are the man of the house - you're almost like the CEO of your own household. Similar to a CEO running a business, would he put any of those decisions for what's best for the business, and ultimately for the employees (your family), onto them?

timing_objection.discovery_urgency_question: Knowing that those right tools and resources are out there, just a handful to grab away, and you can change your life - you being in the current position where you can't do X, Y, Z, and you're stuck in that box - how much longer, how many months, weeks, or even days are you okay actually staying in the same position?
timing_objection.buy_in_approach: 'Not ready to start right now' isn't an objection. Ask: 'Is it a case that, if you did do this and you were to implement XYZ, do you feel that it could ever get to XYZ?' Then get them to explain why.
timing_objection.opportunity_cost: Brother, if you're going to do this regardless, why would it make sense to delay it? When in Q1 2026, you might already have 2 or 3 machines.
timing_objection.busy_life_handling: Busy is great, right? In fact, I wouldn't want you to ever not be busy. Busy is part of a great life. Would you agree? Ultimately for you, is it a case of like it's impossible for you to invest 5 to 10 hours a week to achieve X, Y, Z, Holy Grail?

think_about_it.philosophy: Think about it is bullshit. There's no one who needs to think about things. There's a real reason why. Never do a follow-up on 'think about it.'
think_about_it.core_question: I guess when you go away and take that time, what's coming up that makes you want to think about it?
think_about_it.research_response: Brother, with the greatest respect, the research is right here, right? You can go away, do some research, do some Googles. Ultimately, by speaking with the company, you're getting the most accurate information.
think_about_it.decision_reframe: In life, would it be fair to say that the way we make decisions has led us to where we are now? The decisions you've made and how you've made them up to this point has led you to the exact point you're in now, right?
think_about_it.certainty_close: If you were 100% certain that if you did this today, that within 12 months you'd be at that 10K mark and you'd leave the job, you'd be biting my hand off, right? So what's coming up that makes you not quite 100% certain right now?
think_about_it.pattern_interrupt: I'll call you in a week? No, you won't. You'll no-show me. Come on now, man. What's going on?

diy_objection.philosophy: Cook their logic - if they could do it themselves, they already would have. They're on the call because they need help.
diy_objection.core_strategy: Their logic is flawed because they believe they can run this themselves. That logic is flawed because if they could do that, they already would have done it and they're on the call because they need help.
diy_objection.opportunity_cost: By having the right people in place over the next 2, 3, 4 months, the opportunity cost of what they'd miss out on - if they tried on their own, their snowball would not have created as much.
diy_objection.value_pitch: It's not just having the tools and resources, but also building the skills to utilize them. Over the next 5, 10, 15 years, as you grow this business, expand into other ventures - you have the ability to rely on yourself.

scott.name: Scott Seymour's Objection Playbook
core_principles: It's really hard to lose money with something like this
One sale - can they do it or not

capital_objection.philosophy: I don't want anyone to force the money out. The key question is whether they have a source.
capital_objection.opening: Alrighty, let's see if I can figure this out for you. Totally understand you're investing in a business and investing in yourself.
capital_objection.source_question: First thing I want to see... do you have a source? Do you have it in the bank? Do you have access to credit? Do you have a family member that can lend it to you? I don't need to know who, I don't need to know what... I just want to know if you have a source or not.
capital_objection.payment_plan_pitch: So the way that the payment plan works, because it is a third party company, they want to ensure it's someone who's serious and can afford the investment. What credit score do you think you're rocking right now?
capital_objection.hard_to_lose_money: It's really hard to lose money with something like this because unlike you getting a loan for a car... With a car payment, you spend the money, you don't get it back. Even if you finance the $5,900 and you pay $200-250 extra dollars, you still OWN THE BUSINESS.
capital_objection.low_payment_test: Hey, I mean, if we could get your payment down to $100, $200 bucks a month, I mean, is this something that's reasonable for you and manageable to get you into the community?
capital_objection.when_to_qualify_out: I won't qualify you out until you get rejected from everyone. If Coach doesn't work, then ask about family and friends. Only then note in CRM to circle back.

sticker_shock.initial_response: Totally understand, I know this isn't cheap. Well, starting a business isn't cheap in general.
sticker_shock.franchise_comparison: Some general costs of opening a business - franchising, you're getting a couple hundred thousand dollars. We're here, you get started for as little as a couple thousand.
sticker_shock.venhub_leverage: Do all your other offers have everything we include, including discounted machines, including product ordering? I try to leverage a lot more VenHub, which is more quantifiable for ROI.
sticker_shock.roi_calculator: I'll jump to the ROI calculator if it's the right person. Default: one machine, one location, not even performing well, you're building an asset worth $12,000.

location_finding.non_defensive: I don't really get too defensive. Yeah, well, for that price, you're correct, it's not that expensive, but if you look at companies who guarantee locations, you're usually in for minimum $50,000 to $100,000.
location_finding.quality_frame: That's why our model is built the way it is. They will guarantee you a location, but they're not going to guarantee how good a location is.
location_finding.98_percent_frame: We're getting you 98% of the way there. The final part is you do have to sell yourself. Unfortunately, we're not the boots on the ground, but we're taking a ton of the legwork off of you.
location_finding.credibility_killer: If you go out there and face the objection 'how many locations do you have?' and you say none, then what are you gonna do? All your credibility falls off a cliff. That's why I leverage the community and the brand.

diy_objection.philosophy: Probably one of the hardest ones to overcome. I just put as much fear as possible into them.
diy_objection.fear_approach: What are you gonna do with this, what are you gonna do with that? There's a lot more that goes into this business than meets the eye.
diy_objection.credibility_killer: The big one I really like to hone in on is credibility. The hardest part is landing locations. If they ask 'how many machines do you have?' and you say none, your credibility tanks.
diy_objection.solution: We teach them how to overcome that by leveraging community and brand.

saturation_objection.philosophy: I love this one, this one's not even that bad.
saturation_objection.positive_reframe: When people actually have vending machines, they can actually work for you, specifically the older models. We teach you how to rip and replace those guys.
saturation_objection.new_concept_frame: If we were just doing older vending machines, sure, I'd be concerned about saturation. With all these new AI smart machines, there's a lot of opportunity out there.
saturation_objection.lazy_operator_angle: To be quite frank, there's a lot of lazy operators out there, and we'll teach you how to not be a lazy operator and truly provide the value.

three_option_waterfall: Option 1: Credit card - put a hold on the amount, break it out over 12 months, 15% origination fee
Option 2: Elective - break it down in 3, 6, 9, or 12 months. Good credit = 0% interest. 15% origination fee.
Option 3: Coach - finance up to 144 months, get payments down to $100-$200/month
financing.new_approach: Mention the financed amount first, then if they pay in full, they get the 15% discount. So it looks like they're getting a discount.
financing.capital_strategy: I tend to leverage capital at hand, keeping variable credit open, keeping liquid cash. By having more capital on hand, you could scale quicker.

call_structure.discovery: 15 minutes - Current situation, pain points, vision
call_structure.presentation: 15 minutes - Show VenHub, savings calculator, community
call_structure.close: 10 minutes - Handle objections, close or schedule follow-up

key_scripts_by_situation.opening_a_call: Hey [Name], what's going on? We usually make these calls 30-45 minutes. I've done a few thousand of these, so the most productive ones follow a simple structure.
key_scripts_by_situation.discovering_motivation: What first sparked your interest in vending?
key_scripts_by_situation.future_pacing: Let's say this vending business goes really well for you. What would you be hoping to achieve in the future?
key_scripts_by_situation.identifying_obstacles: What do you feel has been keeping you from getting into vending at this point already?
key_scripts_by_situation.building_urgency: What changed recently that made you really want to start taking this more serious?
key_scripts_by_situation.qualifying_commitment: If we could help you achieve [their goal], do you feel like that would check all the boxes?
key_scripts_by_situation.setting_up_binary_choice: For efficiency at the end of the call, I'm gonna recommend the option that makes sense. It's fine to say yes or no. The one I'd love to avoid is 'think about it' or 'talk to my dog.'
key_scripts_by_situation.presenting_value: Vending in a box - we'll help you end to end on getting in the door with properties.
key_scripts_by_situation.closing: How would you like to proceed?

common_validation_phrases: Okay. Got it. That makes sense.
urgency_phrases: And that's the tough part - if nothing changes now, what does it look like in a year?
Every month that goes past, there's thousands of dollars leaving on the table.
You're fortunate you've hopped on a call as early as you have.
